title: Proctor's Lemenager Changes Boxing Style
text:
Proctor's Lemenager Changes Boxing Style 
By Norman Seawright III   6:36 PM CDT 
Proctor, MN (NNCNOW.com) -- Amy Lemenager is traveling to Nova Scotia to rematch with Taylor Ross on October 23—having defeating her once already at Lorenzi's Boxing—and has a new fighting strategy. 
"This girl's going to be ready for Amy to come out and brawl," said Josh Moore, a coach at Lorenzi's. "If she uses her boxing skills, I'm confident she'll do very well." 
Click here to subscribe to our daily newsletter. 
Lemenager cites Ronda Rousey as a role model, and her offensive style to this point has reflected that. 
"I hit with everything I have," she said. "I'm not really focused on dodging punches. I just kind of walk straight forward." 
All offense and no defense only works if it results in a knockout—otherwise, it can cost points in a decision. This point resonates with Lemenager, who also plays goalie for the Proctor-Hermantown Mirage (PHM) hockey team. 
"Whenever you make a mistake, it shows up on the scoreboard," she said. "Everybody sees it." 
Even with going from a blistering offensive front to what is now a more balanced strategy, the game plan is exactly the same. 
"Not giving it her all or everything she's got is not even an option for her," Moore said. 
Actually—scratch that—the game plan is just slightly different this time. 
"I plan on going to Nova Scotia and showing her I'm not 'Minnesota Nice,'" Lemenager said. 
Sounds like she's ready to rumble.
